titles.title: Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma Illya
Fate/kaleid liner PRISMA☆ILLYA
Fate/Kaleid Liner 프리즈마☆이리야
Prillya
F/K
fk
Fate/kaleid liner プリズマ☆イリヤ
Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma Illya
Kaleid liner Prisma Illya
Fate/kaleid liner 魔法少女☆伊莉雅

relatedanime.anime: Gekijouban Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma Illya: Sekka no Chikai

recommendations.recommendation:
This series was a bit odd. Not sure why they decided to make it but it`s a lot better than you would first think.
It`s got all the normal magical girl elements with a few pretty badass fights in there as well. Also loads of adorable Illya.
Well made and a decent watch, as long as you`re ok with the premise that is.
It`s good fun for Fate/stay Night fans. Episode 6 was epic, but besides that it`s mostly silly. Worth a watch though.

Quite weak start, but very neat end. Recommended for Fate fans, a MUST for Illya fans, and even if you`re not into the Nasuverse, it is still a fun and worthwhile watch.
Not the Illya route you were expecting from F/SN, but this is as good as it gets (but pick the original manga if you can after watching this!)
Not Nanoha level, but still within that league. Solid Mahou Shoujo work, backed by FATE grade budget.
Whatever doubts you might have for this series, make sure to stick around until at least episode 5 and 6. The payoff is definitely worth it.

Underrated series that must be checked out. One of the best magical loli series and -the- best action sequence/effects that even tops Madoka`s 3rd movie for a TV series. Mind-blowing classical terms used from the F/SN visual novel and excellent plot-line. Non-cheesy, though it doesn`t have gore that we all seek in Anime. Nontheless, as everyone has stated ... Episode 6 is the most awe-sought battle event that we were wishing to see again and it was fulfilled to those who are thirsty for the top two agile-crazy overpowered classes. Looking forward to the second season, F/SN Remake, F/SN HF and possibly F/SN UBW TV version.
Type-Moon, you`re too damn awesome to underestimate.

anime.description: * Based on the manga by the same name by http://anidb.net/cr31124 [Hiroyama Hiroshi], itself a spin-off of the http://anidb.net/a3348 [Fate/stay night] erotic visual novel by http://anidb.net/cr927 [Type-Moon]. http://anidb.net/ch241 [Toosaka Rin] and http://anidb.net/ch42327 [Luviagelita Edelfelt] are magi from the Clock Tower, the headquarters of the http://anidb.net/ch1951 [Mage`s Association], and they were sent to Fuyuki City by its http://anidb.net/ch40592 [director] to collect Class Cards, each holding the powers of a Servant from the Holy Grail War. To aid in their quest, they were handed two powerful magic wands, Rin receiving http://anidb.net/ch54376 [Magical Ruby] and Luvia taking http://anidb.net/ch54377 [Magical Sapphire]. However, due to the two girls` inability to get along, the wands got fed up with them and broke their contract. Ruby then sought a new master, and found one in an unsuspecting school girl by the name of http://anidb.net/ch1913 [Illyasviel von Einzbern]. Despite Illya`s protests, Ruby insisted in making a magical girl out of her, and she is now http://anidb.net/ch42302 [Prisma Illya]. With no knowledge in magecraft and no previous training of her own, being in fact a completely normal young girl with no outstanding abilities, now she must collect the powerful Class Cards using whatever limited aid Rin can give her. Will the two at least to enter a truce with Luvia and Sapphire`s http://anidb.net/ch49571 [new master] and work together for this goal? — written by Hinoe Note: The first and second episodes were pre-aired at a special event on 22.06.2013. Regular broadcast started on 06.07.2013.

tag.name: elementary school
tag.description: The term elementary school is used in some countries for schools where children from the age of about five receive primary education.

tag.name: horny nosebleed
tag.description: In Japanese media, healthy young men who have no other sexual outlet will often suffer nosebleeds upon seeing the naked female body, or even just a pair of well-filled panties. The nosebleed is, of course, a visual shorthand/euphemism for sexual arousal. It is commonly interpreted that way for males and females, with little trickles of blood indicating mild arousal, and gushing fountains of blood indicating erection/extreme arousal in both sexes. It can also be interpreted as shorthand strictly for erections in males. In that case, when blood shoots from the nose explosively, and in ridiculous quantity, the implication would be an ejaculation. Source: TVTrope

tag.name: summoning
tag.description: Ability to call/materialize some kind of creature.

tag.name: breast fondling
tag.description: Breast fondling is the act of touching, groping, or fondling the breasts of a person, typically female.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: maid
tag.description: A maid is a female employed in domestic service. They usually wear uniforms. Since their nature is to be obedient and serve their goshujin-sama (master), they are one of the most desired types of women in Japan, a dream of every Japanese man, particularly http://anidb.net/t1133 [otaku]. Often seen in so-called Maid Cafes in Akihabara, where male customers can for a little time enjoy the feeling of being served by a woman. The male gender opposite is the butler.

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: magical girl
tag.description: Magical girls (also known both in Japan and in the West as mahou shoujo, and in Japan as majokko) are young girls with superhuman abilities of magical nature. In the early years, magical girls usually used magic to solve everyday problems and often transformed into idols; nowadays, however, the term is most often used to refer to with girls who fight evil using magical powers, and, although transformations are still common, they tend to be more along the lines of a change of costume.

tag.name: loli
tag.description: Lolita (often also just abbreviated to loli) refers originally to a novel by Vladimir Nabokov. The book is internationally famous for its controversial subject: the narrator and protagonist, middle aged Humbert Humbert, becomes obsessed and sexually involved with a 12-year-old girl named Dolores Haze. Nowadays the name "Lolita" describes a sexually precocious young girl. Related to this is http://anidb.net/t2415 [lolicon], the Japanese abbreviation of the English phrase "Lolita Complex". Sometimes written as "roricon" or "rorikon" due to the inexact mapping between Japanese and English phonemes. This is the term used to describe the fetish/fascination some mature people have for underage girls. There is an entire industry in Japan devoted to providing legal but schoolgirl-themed pornography, taking advantage of the cute childlike appearance some Japanese women maintain well into their twenties. Because the characters in anime are often young by convention, many fans think that a character can only be Lolicon if she is twelve or younger. Exceptions are granted if the other character in the relationship is a lot older. One particular device used to skirt the boundaries of taste and legality is the exotic being (alien, creature of magic, robot or the like) which takes the form of an underage human girl, but is in fact for all other practical purposes an adult. Another reason why lolicon is fetishized by people may be because some of them just view it as a substitute for their fetish for flat-chested, but otherwise well-developed, women. Source: Wikipedia / TV Tropes

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: magic circles
tag.description: A magic circle is circle or sphere of space marked out by practitioners of many branches of ritual magic. It may be marked physically, drawn in salt or chalk, for example, or merely visualised. Traditionally, circles have been used by ritual magicians to form a protective barrier between themselves and what they summoned. Nowadays, circles often have the more benign function of containing and concentrating the energy raised during a ritual. Circles can also be used as barriers for non-magical work such as meditation. Generally, as with most magical practices, an incantation is recited stating the purpose and nature of the circle, often repeating an assortment of divine and angelic names. Source: wiki

tag.name: spellcasting
tag.description: The magic version of “call your attacks”. The protagonist will explicitly call out the magical incantation for the spells.

tag.name: shoujo ai
tag.description: Shoujo Ai means girls love, and thus explores what happens when two girls (or women) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2695 [Yuri] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphic sex. The male version is http://anidb.net/t2783 [Shounen Ai]. http://anidb.net/t7146 [Cute girls doing cute things (CGDCT)] is often mistaken as low level Yuri or Shoujo Ai. If there is no Yuri or Shoujo Ai subtext, i.e. if there is no romantic subtext, only tag CGDCT. Please note: CGDCT and yuri/shoujo ai are not mutually exclusive; it is possible to have an anime tagged both.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: pantsu
tag.description: "Panties" in Japanese. Upskirt views in various positions are typical, however all forms of partial or fully exposed panties are accepted. Exposure is usually accidental, but may also be deliberate. Pantsu views may be exclusive to the viewer without impacting any characters. Bikinis are not pantsu.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: henshin
tag.description: Japanese for "transformation" (metamorphosis or disguise). A "henshin anime" is any anime, where the characters or their costumes transform, such as Sailor Moon. The henshin switches on the character`s special powers, and is frequently accompanied by a costume change. Often the change of clothing is the only outward indicator that the character has changed and yet nobody seems to notice the hero`s true self. Most henshin heroes have a special item which they use to change into their heroic form. These items are usually activated by a command phrase (which is often in Engrish, for some reason), triggering a transformation sequence.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: parental abandonment
tag.description: In Japan it is a common custom for parents to leave their children alone at home and embark on a lifelong trip around the world once they hit the tender age of 14, sometimes even earlier. Of course this is done because the parents believe their children are independent enough to get their act together. But little do they know about the small secrets their offspring has, such as a childhood fiancé(e) or even a forbidden incestuous love between their (often not-blood-related) children. Of course aside from having a huge house, financial support is provided as well. Usually through the means of MAGICAL MONEY. In rare cases the parents actually die (shortly) before embarking on their world-trip, which is self-evidently used as an important plot device in the development of the child.

tag.name: TV censoring
tag.description: The TV version is censored and later DVD/BD releases are uncensored, so the money-grubbing capitalists can make a couple more bucks at our expense.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: tarot
tag.description: The tarot is a pack of playing cards, most commonly numbering 78, used from the mid-15th century in various parts of Europe to play a group of card games such as Italian tarocchini and French tarot. From the late 18th century until the present time, the tarot has also found use by mystics and occultists for divination. Tarot cards are used throughout much of Europe to play card games. In English-speaking countries, where these games are largely unplayed, tarot cards are now used primarily for divinatory purposes. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: show within a show
tag.description: A fictional TV (or radio, or stage) show that takes place within an actual TV show; or, occasionally, a fictional instalment or incarnation of an actual show. Many comedies have short one-off gags where they parody existing shows. Example: A large part of Martian Successor Nadesico is centred around the fictional popular anime Gekigangar III, which is being watched by several characters of the Nadesico crew.

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: gotta catch them all
tag.description: A typical plot or sub-plot for many shows. Either the cast or somebody else, that being often the main antagonist, embarks on a quest to collect things, shiny things. Things that are said to grant simple wishes or even do miracles like bringing people back to life, destroying the whole world, galaxy, universe and in rare cases turning the hero into the greatest Pokemon Master. Those things can be weapons, lost technology, magical artefacts, pieces of a giant magical artefact and in some cases even people or little critters. The point is, there`s stuff to collect!

tag.name: 3D CG animation
tag.description: Abbreviation for "three-dimensional computer generated animation" or "computer graphics" (CGI). The traditional 2D art is enhanced by 3D imagery developed through computer modeling software. Done in the right way, this union of 3D in a 2D animated world can be a very beautiful relationship. The difference lies in what lacks the traditional 2D animation all together and may give term to something produced entirely with 3D graphics (such as the 2006 remake of "Appleseed" , 2007`s "Vexille", the 2008 addition to the "Biohazard" series and the more well known "Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within" and "Advent Children").

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Toosaka Rin
character.description: Toosaka Rin is a model student and idol of Shirou`s school, Rin is secretly a sorceress and Master in the Holy Grail War. She is descended from a long line of sorcerers, and though lacking a formal magic education, is extremely powerful in her own right. Her father was killed in the 4th Holy Grail War, and she has trained since his death to succeed him. She is perceptive, resourceful and avidly competitive. Although she tried to summon a Saber-class Servant, she accidentally called Archer instead. Rin excels in transformation of energy, which includes storage of Mana in objects. She stores all of her mana in jewels that she charges daily to bypass her body`s natural limitations on releasing energy. She can detonate her jewels on contact with an object, resulting in a release of energy equivalent to an attack rank of "A". Her most common offensive spell is "Gandr", which fires concentrated mana in the form of a black orb from her finger. On contact, the spell amplifies physical conditions -- a person who is already sick, for example, becomes far sicker upon being hit. Rin is also proficient with reinforcement sorcery, which she uses on her legs to give herself more speed. Source: Wiki

character.name: Emiya Shirou
character.description: Emiya Shirou is the main character of http://anidb.net/a3348 [Fate/Stay Night], a serious and honest teenager as well as a hard worker who enjoys helping others. He is in his second year of High School, and his hobbies include fixing a variety of broken things, from VCRs to stoves, as well as cooking and cleaning. He has some slight proficiency with reinforcement sorcery, though his foster father http://anidb.net/ch1919 [Emiya Kiritsugu] did not encourage him to improve it. Initially, he is confused about the Holy Grail War and irrationally attempts to shield others, even his own servant Saber, from danger.

character.name: Berserker
character.description: The Servant of Illya, he is a swarthy giant with adamantine skin and immense strength. He wields a colossal stone Axe-Club, and is capable of causing massive destruction with the mere backlash of his swings. As a Berserker, he was stripped of his sanity and reason, acting feral and animalistic in combat. Berserkers are praised as members of the "Strongest" class, though they are difficult to control. Illya, however, appears to have little trouble managing Berserker.

character.name: Rider
character.description: She is the Servant of Shinji, first seen scouting around Homurabara Gakuen. Rider is silent, sultry, and vigilant, never hesitating to shield her Master from harm. With Shinji incapable of lending any Mana to her, she is forced to seek alternative means to augment her abilities. To compensate for this weakened state, Rider employs covert battle tactics and takes full advantage of any territory around her. Her weapon of choice is a pair of long iron nails fastened to opposite ends a single chain, which she effectively thrusts from distances.

character.name: Caster
character.description: An honoured guest of the Ryudou family, permitted to live at their temple until the preparations for her marriage have been finalised. A gorgeous and talented yet mysterious woman of high stature, her presence has attracted the attention of many trainee monks.

character.name: Emiya Kiritsugu
character.description: Emiya Kiritsugu is a professional assassin and hitman. He dedicated most of his life to becoming a "hero of justice", a defender of humankind, through killing people who tended to bring catastrophe or war. He eventually noticed that he would never be able to do that with human abilities alone, and sought the miracle of the Holy Grail to stop conflict. In the aftermath of the 4th Holy Grail War, he saved the life of http://anidb.net/ch1904 [Emiya Shirou], later becoming the boy`s foster father and finally giving up on his quest. He is also a magus, but he never made any serious attempts to train the unskilled Shirou in his craft, in spite of the latter`s insistent requests. He dies in the years between the 4th and 5th Holy Grail Wars.

character.name: Fujimura Taiga
character.description: Taiga is an English teacher at Shirou`s school, homeroom instructor of Shirou`s class and the supervising teacher for the Archery Dojo. She is widely called "Tiger", a nickname she dislikes ("Taiga" and "Tiger" sound similar in Japanese), though Shirou refers to her as "Fuji-nee" (older sister Fuji). After Kiritsugu died, Taiga became Shirou`s guardian and has been living with him for several years. Taiga and Shirou are very close, and she regards him as a younger brother. Taiga is largely a comic relief character; she is irresponsible, clumsy, and prone to sporadic bouts of extreme lethargy or zest. She lives with Shirou under the pretences of being his caretaker, although she cannot cook and lacks many other domestic skills, relying on Shirou to maintain her welfare. Shirou, however, appreciates Taiga`s company, and is more than happy to care for her. When Shirou is in any need of advice, Taiga can be depended on to be a confidante for his worries.

character.name: Sella
character.description: Sella and Leysritt are Ilya`s maids, but they act as her caretakers and instruct her in the secrets of sorcery. Like Ilya, they both have silky blonde hair and deep crimson eyes. Sella is rather fickle and insecure (especially regarding her body), and is very suspicious of Emiya Shirou.

character.name: Leysritt
character.description: Sella and Leysritt are Ilya`s maids, but they act as her caretakers and instruct her in the secrets of sorcery. Like Ilya, they both have silky blonde hair and deep crimson eyes. Leysritt is casual, and has affection for Shirou because his presence makes Ilya happy. Leysritt is skilled in combat, particularly with halberds.

character.name: Majutsu Kyoukai
character.description: A trans-national, self-preservative organisation created by western magi for the purpose of controlling, concealing and developing Magecraft. Founded around the Middle Ages by those who foresaw the decline of Magecraft, they decided that in order to preserve their power Thaumaturgy should drift apart from society and become a secret known only by a necessary minimum number of people. It has many laboratories and research bodies that seek to advance the progress of Thaumaturgy, as well as institutions that transmit their secrets to the next generation. Although the emphasis lies on the pursuit of knowledge, the Association also seeks to increase its own military strength so it can defend itself against those that might threaten it, such as the Holy Church, other mystic organizations and supernatural forces seeking punish mankind for meddling with areas that should not be touched. The Mage`s Association is currently headquartered at the Clock Tower in London.

character.name: Seidou Kyoukai
character.description: The Holy Church, also referred simply as "the Church", is a worldwide religious organisation, apparently styled after the real Roman Catholic Church. It is a powerful faction in the Nasuverse, with several important characters in the `verse works being its active or former members. On the surface, they coexist rather peacefully with the http://anidb.net/ch1951 [Mage`s Association], but that is only out of necessity, and neither group will waste an opportunity to backstab the other. They sometimes act as arbiters in the Association`s internal disputes; one such example are the Holy Grail Wars. Aside their regular duties as a normal religious group, they have a few special agencies dedicated to supernatural events. The Assembly of the Eighth Sacrament, the lowest among the Church`s special agencies, is charged with researching, recovering and managing Holy Relics, items considered to have the holy attribute, scattered around the world. Their name comes from the seven Sacraments of the Catholic Church. As the Holy Grail is a Holy Relic, they`re in charge of managing every Holy Grail that appears; as such, in order to watch over the Holy Grail War, the priest stationed at Fuyuki City is always a member of this agency and is the one who acts as the war`s Supervisor. The Church is also very active and relentless in the pursue and elimination of heretics, beings acting in disagreement with the Holy Scriptures. The members of the Church in that line of work are called Executors, and their specialties include magus hunting, demon killing, and vampire slaying. Among them, the most powerful ones are members of the Burial Agency, a group always composed of eight Executors, one of whom is the leader and another of whom is not an acting member, but a backup. Members of the Burial Agency work alone, and they will act without orders if they deem necessary, even going as far as skewering bishops, which earned them the reputation of the most heretic group inside the Church. Among the items the Holy Church uses for its purposes, one can find the many types of Keys of Providence, Conceptual Weapons used for purification, and the Holy Scriptures, very powerful Conceptual Weapons used only by a few select Executors. Examples of Keys of Providence are http://anidb.net/ch1916 [Kotomine Kirei]`s most used weapons, the Black Keys, sword-shaped items that can be thrown at an opponent in order to pierce them and that do not have a blade when inside the priest`s frock. An example of a Holy Scripture is the Seventh Holy Scripture, used by http://anidb.net/ch1941 [Ciel], a massive metal weapon which can kill a vampire through physical power alone, shoots Bible pages, has an unicorn horn for a bayonet, and has a http://anidb.net/ch31725 [residing spirit].

character.name: Irisviel von Einzbern
character.description: Irisviel von Einzbern is the heroine of the Fate/Zero story, the mother of Illyasviel von Einzbern and Kiritsugu`s wife. A homunculus prototype created by the Einzbern family with the idea to give birth to an ultimate homunculus. Like many of the Einzberns, she is skilled in alchemy. Irisviel serves as Saber`s proxy Master, since Kiritsugu believes that he and Saber are incompatible.

character.name: Assassin
character.description: Assassin is actually the reincarnation of the head of the Assassin Order. While every Assassin in every Grail War thus recorded has shared the same name of Hassan-i Sabbāh, they are different persons as all the leaders of the Assassin Order changed their names to Hassan-i Sabbāh upon ascending to the position. The Hassan-i Sabbāh in the Fourth War became head by intentionally fracturing his psyche during life to confuse opponents, a form of self-inflicted dissociative identity disorder. When summoned as a Servant, this ability manifests itself as the Noble Phantasm Zabaniya: Delusional Illusion, which splits his body into up to eighty different entities, sharing his spiritual potential amongst them. They act as reconnaissance agents for Tokiomi and Kirei after Gilgamesh "kills" one of them. Assassin can only be truly defeated if all of them are killed. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Saber Alter
character.description: Saber Alter is what becomes of http://anidb.net/ch38 [Saber] after being consumed by evil. This version of Saber appears in the Heaven`s Feel route of the Fate/Stay Night visual novel. Saber becomes Saber Alter after being consumed and regurgitated by http://anidb.net/ch39799 [Dark Sakura]. In that situation, Saber has a much stronger offensive ability when compared to how she was as http://anidb.net/ch1904 [Emiya Shirou]`s servant, but the evil in her decreases other abilities, like her magical resistance. She doesn`t lose her mind, but her personality is twisted, and her inherent character alignment changes from Lawful Good to Lawful Evil. Her ties with her original objectives and the people she cared for are severed, and her choices spin around Dark Sakura`s goals instead.

character.name: Kaleido-Ruby
character.description: Kaleido-Ruby is a magical girl version of http://anidb.net/ch241 [Toosaka Rin]. Rin becomes Kaleido-Ruby when she wields the Kaleidostick, one of the inventions of http://anidb.net/ch40592 [Kischur Zelretch Schweinorg]. The Kaleidostick`s ability is to gather prana and knowledge from "versions" of the wielder in alternate dimensions (parallel universes), effectively giving the "current dimension" version large sources of both, but it comes with a catch: the Kaleidostick is a sentient wand that profoundly dislikes its creator, and it likes to place its wielder into humiliating situations; for Rin, this manifests as dressing her up as a magical girl. The wand works through evocation of the Second True Magic, of which little is known other than the fact it operates with parallel universes, that Zelretch is the living person to best understand it and even he cannot fully grasp it, that not even http://anidb.net/ch1906 [the only known Servant from the future] fully understands it, that a few Nasuverse techniques and some of Zelretch`s inventions use it, and that Rin attempts to learn about it over the course of one of the routes in the http://anidb.net/a3348 [Fate/Stay Night] visual novel and afterwards; the events of the Fate/Hollow Ataraxia visual novel are triggered, among other things, by her spectacular failure at a Second True Magic experiment.

character.name: Bazett Fraga McRemitz
character.description: Bazett Fraga McRemitz is a magus sent from the http://anidb.net/ch1951 [Mage`s Association] to fight the 5th Holy Grail War. She was born in Ireland as a descendant of an old family of magi that had detached itself from the Association, but she chose to join the Association regardless. Despite her rare lineage, she was dismissed, and decided to employ her abilities as a hunter of those that had been given a Sealing Designation. She is mentioned very briefly in the http://anidb.net/a3348 [Fate/Stay Night] visual novel. She was the original Master of http://anidb.net/ch1908 [Lancer], but http://anidb.net/ch1916 [Kotomine Kirei] betrayed her and stole her command spells, fatally injuring her in the process. In Fate/Hollow Ataraxia, she is saved by the servant http://anidb.net/ch40363 [Avenger] and acts as his Master.

character.name: Kischur Zelretch Schweinorg
character.description: Kischur Zelretch Schweinorg is one of five living magicians capable of true magic beyond modern science or magecraft. He has control over the Second Magic, "Kaleidoscope", which allows for the "Operation of Parallel Worlds." He fought and defeated Brunestud of the Crimson Moon, the king of vampires, but was bitten in the process and became a Dead Apostle Ancestor, a vampire, thus attaining immortality. He is one of the few characters who appear in more than one of the stories of the Nasuverse, appearing in http://anidb.net/a1015 [Tsukihime] manga and Prologue in the Plus Period artbook, and the Heaven`s Feel scenario of http://anidb.net/a3348 [Fate/stay night]. He supervised the creation of the Holy Grail War ritual, and was a master to the heads of Makiri, Toosaka and Einzbern families at the time. Source: typemoon.wikia.com

character.name: Prisma Illya
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch83473 [Illyasviel von Einzbern], turned http://anidb.net/t2503 [magical girl].

character.name: Luviagelita Edelfelt
character.description: Luviagelita or simply Luvia is a wealthy and proud young woman and mage. In Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma Illya she is assigned to work together with Rin to capture the Class Cards. After Sapphire abandons her, Luvia immediately adopts Sapphire`s new master, Miyu, and guides her to capture the Class Cards. She is indiscriminate in using her wealth, erecting a mansion across the street from Einzbern house in a single day, where she and Miyu are currently living. Her rivalry with Rin stems from their mutual crush on Shirou, who fails to notice their attraction to him Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Miyu Edelfelt
character.description: A mysterious girl who is chosen by Sapphire to become its new master and then adopted by Luvia. She takes her duties as a Magical Girl very seriously and is initially dismissive of Illya`s abilities, but gradually warms up to Illya. She comes to value Illya`s friendship greatly and is highly protective of her. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Magical Sapphire
character.description: A Kaleidostick, the younger sister of Magical Ruby, that enables Miyu to become a Magical Girl. Sapphire was originally assigned to Luvia, but, as with Ruby, Sapphire abandoned Luvia after becoming tired of how she was constantly quarreling with Rin. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Iori
character.description: Iori is a mascot character from Magical Bushidou Musashi anime which Illya watches. Iori is Musashi`s familiar and gives her magical power. Note: Anime-only character.

character.name: Magical Bushidou Musashi
character.description: Magical Bushidou Musashi is a heroine of Magical Bushidou Musashi anime which Illya watches. She is a magical girl who is a self-proclaimed messenger of love, justice and humanity. She has a familiar Iori.

character.name: Prisma Illya
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch65744 [Chloe] takes over http://anidb.net/ch42302 [Illya`s] body, and installs http://anidb.net/ch1906 [Archer`s] class card.

character.name: Prisma Miyu
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch71988 [Miyu] installs http://anidb.net/ch38 [Saber`s] class card.

character.name: Prisma Miyu
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch49571 [Miyu Edelfelt], turned http://anidb.net/t2503 [magical girl].

character.name: Illyasviel von Einzbern
character.description: In contrast with her http://anidb.net/ch1913 [Fate/stay night counterpart], Illya has had a normal childhood, growing up with no knowledge of magic or the Holy Grail War. She lives with her brother http://anidb.net/ch1904 [Shirou] and is looked after by her maids http://anidb.net/ch1939 [Leysritt] and http://anidb.net/ch1934 [Sella] when her parents http://anidb.net/ch1919 [Kiritsugu] and http://anidb.net/ch25939 [Irisviel] are away. She is a fan of http://anidb.net/t2503 [magical girl] anime, and daydreams about becoming one. When she encounters a magic wand named http://anidb.net/ch54376 [Magical Ruby], Illya is tricked into signing a contract and http://anidb.net/ch42302 [becoming a magical girl]. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 誕生!魔法少女!
Birth! A Magical Girl!
Ein Magical Girl wird geboren!
Naissance d`une Magical Girl
Tanjou! Mahou Shoujo!
episode.summary: Illyasviel Von Einzbern, or Illya for short, is an ordinary girl living in Fuyuki City. One day, while she`s taking her bath at night, a suspicious magical stick, "Magical Ruby" suddenly flies in, and tries to tempt Illya into becoming a magical girl...?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 誰?
Who?
Wer ist das?
Qui ?
Dare?
episode.summary: Illya gets dragged into becoming magical girl, but she decides what`s done is done and tries to be positve as she practices her magic. However, her practice was all just Ruby teasing her. And so, Illya is forced to handle her first mission without knowing how to use any magic... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 空白 夜の終わり
A Blank, and the End of Night...
Das Ende einer ausdruckslosen Nacht
Kuuhaku Yoru no Owari
episode.summary: It looked like Rin and Luvia`s attacks had managed to defeat the Class Card, Saber, however, they failed to deliver a fatal blow, and everyone faces a counterattack from Saber`s Noble Phantasm, Excalibur. When Illya receives an attack boasting such unprecedented power, a sudden change occurs?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 選択肢は2つ...?
There Are Two Options?
Haben wir eine andere Wahl?
Il y a deux options... ?
Sentakushi wa Futatsu...?
episode.summary: Illya and the others are attacked when Saber suddenly appears. In order to rescue Rin and Luvia who suffered severe injuries while caught off guard, Illya and Miyu fight together. However, Illya`s still not used to fighting, making it hard for her to face Saber, and she gets caught in a predicament. What strategy does Ruby have to save the day?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 負けました
We Lost
Wir haben verloren
On a perdu
Makemashita
episode.summary: The two teams: Illya and Rin, and Miyu and Luvia head to the riverbed to collect the next Card and face off against Caster. Because Caster is high up in the air, Illya and Miyu have to learn how to fly in order to defeat her. Illya is able to fly with ease, but Miyu has a difficult time. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガール ミーツ ガール
Girl Meets Girl
Mädchen trifft Mädchen
Girl Meets Girl
Girl Meets Girl
episode.summary: A mysterious girl, Miyu, suddenly appears when Illya falls into a pinch on her first mission. Miyu then transfers to Illya`s school, but not only does she fail to get along with her new classmates, she seems to be against fighting alongside Illya. However, the place Miyu moves into is right in front of Illya`s house?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 普通の女の子に戻ります
I`m Going to Be a Normal Girl Again
Ich werde wieder ein normales Mädchen sein!
Je vais redevenir une fille normale ?
Futsuu no Onnanoko ni Modorimasu
episode.summary: When Illya recovers her memory during the fight with Assasin, she suffers shock, and grows hesistant to talk to anyone, even Miyu. Now that Illya truly understands the cost and meaning of being a magical girl, she feels terrified and after deep consideration she goes to speak with Rin. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝利と逃走
Victory and Flight
Sieg und Flucht
Victoire et fuite
Shouri to Tousou
episode.summary: Everyone managed to pull through somehow, but the next day Illya comes down with a high fever from the strain. Illya takes the day off of school to rest along with Miyu who calls her through Sapphire and Ruby`s video phone. But when Illya sees Miyu in her maid uniform, she... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Kaleidoscope
Kaleidoscope
Kaleidoskop
Kaleidoscope
Kaleidoscope
episode.summary: Even after drawing out the Class Card`s true power and managing to damage Berserker, Miyu is still facing a difficult battle. But Illya enters her Trance and comes running to save Miyu from her pinch! Though Berserker, their greatest enemy yet, still stands before them, when the two Kaleid Liners combine their power, a miracle occurs! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ここで終わらせる
I`ll End It Here!
Hier werde ich es beenden!
Koko de Owaraseru
episode.summary: Miyu, Rin, and Luvia head to the Mirror World to defeat the final Class Card, Berserker, however they`re all having a hard time against Berserker`s almost invincible power. Meanwhile, Illya is feeling down as she bathes after running away from being magical girl when her mother, Iri bursts in on her?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ルビーちゃんのドキッ☆ブルマだらけの大反省会
Episode S1
Ruby-chan no Doki Bloomers-darake no Daihanseikai
クイズ☆マジカルルビオネア
Episode S2
Quiz Magical Rubyonaire
